trial_identification.studytitle: Does magnesium sulphate reduce length of stay and improve spirometry in acute moderate to severe asthma when initial treatment fails?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Adults with acute asthma non responsive to initial treatment treated with intravenous magnesium sulphate versus placebo as an adjunct to standard care;the effect on lung function and length of stay in hospital.
trial_identification.trialacronym:
ASsesing THe use of Magnesium in Asthma
ASTHMA

interventions.interventions:
Intravenous magnesium sulphate as a single dose of 20mmol in 100mls normal saline as a slow infusion over 30-40 minutes In addition to standard care/treatment 3x5mg nebulizations of salbutamol and 1x500mcg nebulization of atrovent and 50mg oral prednisolone. Further salbutamol 5mg nebulizations as required prn for the next 4 hours ( duration of the trial intervention protocol) After this time patient is either discharged or admitted and treatment is determined by the admitting clinician according to need.
Standard care with nebulizations and oral prednisolone given first then if eligible for the trial then given magnesium suplate or placebo and additional ventolin nebulizations as required for the duration of the intervention (4hours)
interventions.comparator: Placebo as normal saline 100mls in addition to standard care/treatment as described above.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: 4 hours post intervention ( treatment with magnesium)

primaryOutcome.outcome: total duration of stay in hospital in hours
primaryOutcome.timepoint: from time of enrollment to discharge from hospital

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Improvement in lung function as measured by spirometry
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 4 hours post intervention and at followup 72 hours post intervention
at any time from enrolment to 4 hours post intervention

secondaryOutcome.outcome: need for admission to intensive care
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: from time of enrollment to discharge from hospital

secondaryOutcome.outcome: need for invasive or non invasive ventilation
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: from time of enrollment to discharge from hospital

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Acute asthma exacerbation requiring attendance to an emergency department
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: life threatening asthma pregnancy other respiratory diseases eg pulmonary embolis,pneumonia

trial_design.concealment: Allocation by pharmacy numerical ordering. Numbered plain containers for drug and placebo.
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomization by pharmacy via computerised sequence generation
